comment.text: Omg. This restaurant was perfect the food and ambiance. The food was so tasty and fresh. I highly recommend it.

We came to the restaurant as a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) for an early dinner on a Friday night. The restaurant was pretty much empty at this time. Nevertheless we were seated at a "prime" spot right by the utility room with a constant people traffic behind our backs. I could enjoy the view of mops, baskets and other such like things every 5 seconds the curtain to the utility room would open. Not a very relaxing atmosphere I should say. 
Our waiter was very unfriendly. Kids were interested in the lamps on a table.  As soon as the waiter came to our table he took the lamps out of kids' hands. He was very rude while doing this. With a cold stone face. My son nearly started crying. He could have done this more politely if these lamps are such a treasure and can't be touched. The waiter offered water. We agreed to complimentary tap water. Only three of us ended up with glasses of water. My daughter was left without a glass for God knows what reason. We were also left with just one wine glass. I don't know how much more careless a waiter can be with his guests. Haven't met such a rude, careless, unfriendly waiter in a very long time. We ended up leaving the place without making a food order. This place should make an effort and treat their guests with some respect. The only positive thing out of today's visit that I can mention is that interior design was lovely. But don't bother coming here for a nice family dinner.

First of all STUNNING ! I would easily say this is one of the prettiest restaurants I've eaten at in Atlanta in a while. I went there on a whim so I did it have a reservation (def get a reservation) - they were committed for the night so I sat at the bar. The win list was amazing and the bartender was great and suggested a few wines to me. I ordered the lamb chops and they were cooked and seasoned to perfection. Service was excellent. Food was great. Ambiance was perfect ! The bartender gave me a complimentary glass of champagne to end my night which was very nice - would definitely go back
Gorgeous restaurant! The starters were very good. The main courses were disappointing. It was very difficult for using the valet parking.

Wow is all I can say! Went to celebrate wife's birthday and the experience was exceptional! Good food and service, plus the decor at this place was amazing! Loved so much we went back the very next day! Feels good to find a place that understands quality and service! Says a lot about the management here, they totally get it!

Our server Tyler was amazing! He had so many recommendations from wine to food, he was so sweet and made our first experience so pleasant. I'll definitely be back and request him. The ambiance was beautiful too and the food was so good. Ask for Tyler when you come! The cheese rolls and quail was phenomenal.

photos.caption: Cheese rolls, Brussel sprouts, quail, lamb chops & bread

comment.text: Food was delicious. I made reservations for my friends birthday. They were able to accommodate a large party, waitress was a attentive, and food came out fairly quick. Grilled Octopus

I really wanted to like this place, since I've been hearing such great things about it. The restaurant itself was gorgeous from the inside. Maybe I just caught them on a busy night, but I would say the experience for me was just mediocre. Our server was friendly and very informative about the menu. We ordered drinks and appetizers at the same time. Our appetizers arrived and we're finished before our drinks arrived. Our entrees didn't come out until 45 minutes after that. While the food was good, the portions weren't as ample as you get at other Middle Eastern restaurants in the Buckhead area for about the same price point.
The ambiance at this restaurant is a 10/10, one of the cutest places in Atlanta. The food was okay though, I honestly think delbar or rumis food is better, would 100% go back for drinks though!

This restaurant is nothing short of beautiful! We loved the decor with perfect lighting and food to match. We sat at the bar and had cocktails, falafel for a starter and kabobs for our main dishes. Everything was flavorful, warm, and portioned just right. We also loved the complimentary pita bread. We will definitely be back.
Loved the amazing ambiance and sultry lit atmosphere. Perfect location for a girls night, romantic date, or solo date night

photos.caption: Filet mignon kebabs, pita, and beverage

comment.text: Quite refreshing and delightful.   First the atmosphere is nice casual yet elegant.  Noise levels are very good for holding conversation during the meal.  The service was good extremely friendly, helpful and needing little more experience.  The food quality was nearly perfect.  Great apps like beets, cauliflower, and grilled octopus were all very good to exceptional.  Great flavors and most certainly worth the visit.   The lamb shank did not meet the same exceptional standard.  Lamb appeared to be rushed and thus not tender.  The quality of meat seems good and flavors were good, but hidden by the cooking.   Overall there are items on this menu wanting to come back regularly.  Hopefully the lamb shank was a rare miss.  I will certainly come back as there are several other items on menu that look worthy!

The food is so delicious! We had hummus, pita & the rack of lamb, it was prepared & plated perfectly. The cocktails suggested by our server (who was great by the way) were perfect pairings for our dinner. 
The atmosphere is wonderful. Beautifully designed and offers a very intimate feel even though it's a larger space.
Great Lebanese food, the fresh hot complimentary bread to start with zaatar and olive oil to nice ambiance and wine selection and food presentation!

photos.caption: Fried Kebbé balls, shrimp, octopus, potato harra layers cheese rolls!

comment.text: Love the food and ambience. The service was good. On my list for upscale date nights.

I was so excited to hear that there was a fancy Lebanese spot opening up! I went to try Zakia and I was very impressed. Decor felt like I was in Lebanon, they definitely stuck to their roots for ambiance. The dishes were Al traditional dishes I grew up with but more elevated which was a delightful twist to try. I would definitely go back, give it a try!

This was the first - and last - time we ate at this establishment. The website has many entrees that are not, in fact, on the menu.  This is classic bait and switch".  The baba ganoush was inedible and the 
The restaurant is all glass walls, so is like an echo chamber with noise levels so high that any conversation across the table is impossible.  The waiter nearly whispered, so none of us could hear her.  She never once came to fill water glasses or see how things were going.  After tasteless starters, we had to finally ask another wait person to find her so we could order out main course. The chicken skewers were absolutely flavorless - just chunks of unseasoned chicken cooked on a stick. All this uncomfortable setting, flavorless food and useless service the bill was $100.  We will never go back.

As a Lebanese person I was excited to see a true Lebanese restaurant open ITP and they have kibbe naya which I previously could only get when I visit my mom in NYC. The naya is great, but for the price point the service was lacking both times I went. I gave it a second chance and won't be giving it a third. Kitchen messed up our order then tried to charge for their mistake, long waiting period after we sat down before getting served and we were 10 min early for a reservation we had for 3 weeks. For a restaurant that requires a CC to hold a ressie and is $200-300 for a two person dinner, the service should be a lot better. More frequent and attentive, to say the least.

This place was amazing, the food was very tasty and the service was great. Waiters were very attentive and on point. The ambiance was great for a date night and time with friends. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Just a short hop off the hospitality highway you find a lovely but rather inhospitable Lebanese restaurant.  I joined a friend at the bar who had just had a $300 work dinner there. We were at the back end of the bar and the staff seemed to be having a frat party back there. Loud, rude. They only had one glass of Pinot Noir left for my friend, but showed us there was another ounce or two left in the bottle but refused to top her off. I had arrived at 9:30. I ordered a cocktail with Sumac tequila that was lovely. At 10pm we ordered a second round. A different bartender said "sorry, they closed us down". Who is they?!  When we asked why there wasn't a last call they said "we usually stop serving at 10pm". To which I replied:  I didn't see that sign when I came in".  When the other bartender walked up we asked why weren't given a last call.  He rudely / begrudgingly offered to make me a drink but told my friend she couldn't have a second glass of wine because they were out of Pinot. Didn't even give her an opportunity to order a different wine.   They ambiance is nice but the service is unacceptable.
Favorite restaurant in Buckhead. Service is perfect and food matches. Beautiful aesthetic.
Atlanta has landed an upscale modern Lebanese restaurant. Everything about this restaurant is amazing! The location, the ambience, the decor, the energy and of course the delicious Lebanese food.

Went last night with our good friends for the first time. The first thing I noticed was how absolutely beautiful the decor was. The food was fresh and amazing. Three of us got the chicken kebabs and my wife got the beef/lamb kafta kebabs. The Baba Ganush was the the best that I've ever had. Our waiter was excellent in his knowledge of the menu and gave us a thorough history of the restaurant as well as the owners. I don't eat rice so our waiter got me eggplant stew which was excellent. By the way he reminded me of a character from Indiana Jones Temple of Doom. He said that he is a part time actor. Our wives had a misunderstanding on who was supposed to make the reservation and realized that we didn't have one. Luckily the guy at the front desk (Kevin?) got us a table - thank you!!! The general manager (Dan?) who was very welcoming came by our table to check up on us.

Highly recommended: the fried kibbeh and the red wine braised lamb shank. Everyone in the party loved both of these. The grape leaves were also excellent. The cauliflower tasted good but was cooked a bit unevenly.  The one item the table didn't particularly care for was the green beans. Overall the food was very good. The service was welcoming and the prices reasonable.

Such a wonderful experience. The decor is lovely. Especially appreciated the velvet loveseat seating arrangement & beautiful lighting. The food was divine. We shared several mezze for the table. The standouts were the hummus (most creamy & delicious I have ever had), the Octopus was melt in your mouth tender with a delicious carrot salad on the side, the grape leaves were so fresh & the quail (my 1st experience with quail, perfect mix of savory, creamy with a hint of sweetness). For the main course we had the sea bass- excellent. The wine list was unusual in the best way..got to try Lebanese wine and it was great. The deserts were also great...the sticky toffee pudding was my fave. I will come back here again soon... many more things I look forward to trying. Service was also warm, knowledgeable & unhurried. So lovely!!

My friends and I came into Zakia and really enjoyed everything about it from the food to service to ambiance. Our Lebanese server Judy recommended the most delicious plates and we were not disappointed! We had an amazing time experiencing the Lebanese culture and she made sure of it.
We will definitely be coming back.

Came for lunch - first ones in and only ones in restaurant for first 20-30 minutes. Was expecting based off price and ambiance for this to be a top notch dining experience. They appear to be focused on upselling items instead of providing good customer service. Case in point : one member of my party was gluten free. Kudos for asking for allergies but big fail in attempting at all to accommodate them. We ordered the hummus which comes with pita. A GF request for something such as cucumber to dip in the hummus was denied, suggesting we order a different dish which comes with cucumber. Wrong drinks brought, total inattentive waitress (no drink refills). After 45 minutes of waiting for our mains (now almost an hour after arriving) we asked for a check. Manager comped with little else to say. Way overpriced for the level of service.

This was a a phenomenal experience. The ambiance is incredible and the food is so good. Tyler is the VERY BEST!! He provided amazing recommendations and I took them all-- he also paid attention to all the details-- allowing us to taste the wine and try the sauces. Tyler was so knowledgeable about the history of all the food, I was just so, so impressed. We ordered the lamb chops, quail, cheese rolls and Brussels sprouts. 10/10. Bravo!!!
this restaurant was top quality food & service periode. I usually don't leave reviews but this young lady her name was Olivia hostess. long story short, she made my visit the best ! thank you so much

Everything about Zakia is superlative: the cuisine is skillfully prepared and beautifully presented; the service is impeccable and the ambiance is whatever you'd like it to be...whatever suits your mood...it's tastefully elegant, comfortably relaxed, enticingly innovative as well as the spot in Atlanta to savor the simple yet complex flavors of the Middle-East.

Party of 6....multiple mezzas , lots of bread, and various meals ordered....EVERYTHING was exceptional. Service on point, and attentive. Tyler/turbo  our waiter was good humored while still professional. The whole staff that assisted him were on point, gracious and helpful! Thoroughly enjoyed our evening and meals. They did not disappoint!

The food was delicious! Everything it was hyped up to be! The inside of the restaurant was BEAUTIFUL! Definitely a cool vibe for a date or for a night out with friends. The customer service was also phenomenal! Our waitress was able to explain everything on the menu, offer great recommendations, and was super attentive. 10/10 would recommend this to everyone. We will be going back!

photos.caption: Kafta kebab with Brussel sprouts and the side of rice (comes with each main)

comment.text: My friends and I just came to Zakia to try it out for the first time. We ordered a hummus to start off with, and for $9 the portion was extremely small and below average compared to other Lebanese restaurants. The complimentary bread, also, seemed like store bought pita. We ended up having something come up where we needed to leave in a rush and let our waiter know. He took our credit card. Rather than understanding our situation, the waiter attended other tables and closed out another table's check before ours. We only got our credit card and check 10-15 minutes later when one of my friends got up and asked our waiter. Will not try again! Ambiance was great though lol!

This restaurant is amazing! Our waiter Tyler was phenomenal in his service. He was well qualified to advise us on the menu and how we should order. Our experience was wonderful during a celebration dinner and we highly recommend this place. Kevin the manager was also very accommodating and we were pleased. The food was so fresh and delicious. Everything we ordered was mouthwatering and huge hit! The ambience was also one of the best parts. The decor was beautiful and classy.
Food, service and ambiance are all fantastic! Great for birthdays or small gatherings.
I had a reservation for 8:45 and waited over 30 minutes for a table. I felt bad for the hostess. I ended up eating next door.
Depending on your taste buts. This is def authentic food. So I wasn't as use to it as I thought, when I ordered the lamb. The grape leaves were delicious

This was my first time to visit Zakia.  I must say I was thoroughly impressed!  The food- Amazing, The Ambiance-Beautiful, the service-Incredible!!  This spot hit all the right buttons.  If you have not tried it... you are missing out on a fabulous experience!

A Las Vegas restaurant has arrived in Atlanta!!! But in decor only!!!! From the fake Corinthian columns to the gold brass trim, Home Depot chandeliers, black velvet pillows and the occasional escort girl, you will feel you have been transported to the strip! The only thing missing is the actual good food, good service & slot machines.  The service is slow, food is prepared well but totally uneventful.  We waited for 20 minutes for our cocktails and we made a reservation.  The server brought us the wrong appetizers and looked at us like we were asking for the moon when we asked for the correct order. Atlanta has done it again. Another bad restaurant that will do well. It is the place to show off your designer goods and nothing more.

Saturday 8/19/2023 around 9pm my husband and I were dinning. Everything was great until, I heard a loud voice yell GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY KITCHEN . As my husband and I looked up it was one of the Head chefs, yelling at an African American male. As the chef proceeded to yell all of a sudden you hear from the chef , punch me , swing then ... The employee walked away . This situation was unacceptable it completely ruined my husbands celebration. For the restaurant  to be semi upscale this is not the type of events that should take place here. After that incident the entire mood of the establishment changed in a negative way. I will never come here again, and I will make sure to spread the word of the decorum that took place on this night.

Most of our food was very good! We ordered grape leaves, baba ghanoush, hummus, kafta kabobs, chicken kabobs, and loubieh. Everything was really good except for the baba ghanoush. It is described on the menu as smoked eggplant, but it tasted like I was eating a cigarette. It was so bad we had to send it back. Baba Ghanoush is one of my favorite foods and I have made it many times, also charring the skin, but this was on another level. It was a HUGE disappointment. That's my only complaint, but it rates high for me since I was really looking forward to that dish. Hopefully, the chef will tweak his recipe to make it more appealing. Outside of that, the service was good and the atmosphere was great! If you like Mediterranean food, definitely check out Zakia!
I absolutely LOVE this restaurant. From the food to the service, it's all top-notch. The GM also took some time to speak with us and really made the night feel special. We can't wait to come back!!
Awesome!!! Best food and best service... awesome drinks... try spice market drink ...
Food and service were both amazing! From the moment you walk in until you leave, everything was great! Will definitely return!

The worst experience I've ever had. They are very unaccommodating to allergies and after getting sick from the food management did not show understanding. The food was average, nothing special. Service was poor.

Horrible customer service, the staff is rude and unwelcoming. I will never step foot in the restaurant again and warn people to not waste their time. There are other restaurants much more worthy of your money and time in the area.
Food was good! Do not valet! Took us 45 mins to get our car . Worse parking system ever !! Uber only

Ambiance was fabulous. Parking and valet were challenging. Service was off. Hoping it was just an off night. Appetizers were fabulous especially the humans. Sea bass was over seasoned and soaked in oil. Salmon was terrific as was the Lebanese rice. Also a bit pricey. I will try again in a few months.

Food, Service, Atmosphere, all wonderful!!! When I booked the reservation I specifically requested a quiet table. We were then seated right next to the host stand. Although I put in my reservation to have a quieter table, we were told that was the only table available . I need to also note that we had an earlier reservation of 6:00pm. When we got to the restaurant,  15 minutes early at that. Only three other tables were taken. Luckily we were greated by Tyler who had this whole experience do a 180 degree turn. Me and my son had a fun memorable experience. Food and service was flawless!!! Just really wish we could've had a better table.
Really nice space with a great feel. The octopus is outstanding. We tried lots of stuff all was excellent. One of our new go to places.
